epd_metadata.epd_owner_address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia
epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.product_use: Concrete prepared by mixing cement, coarse and fine aggregates, and water, with or without auxiliary agents and additives, placed on building site or prefabricated in factory moulds, compacted and hardened by hydration of cement.

product_classes.normal_class: Designed for everyday applications such as residential and commercial foundations, driveways and footpaths.
product_classes.special_class: Supplied to major construction projects including high rise buildings, dams, spillways, roads, bridges, public works infrastructure; includes high-strength, high-durability, marine application, post-tensioned, high-pumpability, super workable, piling concrete, architectural off-form finishes and decorative applications.

product_description.hazardous_substances: None of the products contain substances listed in the Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern for authorisation exceeding 0.1% by weight.
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging.

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D
lca_information.reference_service_life: Not specified; scope is cradle to delivery

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)
databases_and_software.note: Environmental impacts from existing EPDs do not include EN15804+A1 and Green Star (v1.3) impact categories; these are modelled separately.

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight at quarry and m³ of concrete at batching plant; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible.

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, construction, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transport to/from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered via trucks and ships without packaging.

data_quality.assessment: Good or very good geographic and temporal representativeness
data_quality.background_data_timeliness: All data updated within 10 years as required by PCR 2019:14

installation.operational_control: No operational control by Holcim; assumptions based on industrial expertise and GCCA tool
installation.activities: Pouring concrete from ready-mix truck and pump; manual finishing; excludes pre-installation activities such as site work and forms.

end_of_life.control: No control by Holcim over end-of-life fate

deconstruction.process: Physical drilling and removal using hydraulic excavator

benefits_and_loads_beyond_system_boundar.use_of_recycled_aggregate: Recycled aggregate replaces virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements

targets.2030: Embodied carbon of all construction materials to be at least 40% lower
targets.2050: All new construction materials to be net zero

carbonation.description: Natural process where concrete absorbs CO2 from atmosphere through chemical reaction with hydration products; also called reabsorption.
carbonation.note: CO2 absorption not considered in this EPD and not reflected in results tables.

allocation_approach.fly_ash: Treated as waste material; only transport impacts included (AusLCI process)
allocation_approach.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Allocated economically due to significant economic value at collection point (AusLCI process)
allocation_approach.silica_fume: Treated as waste material; only transport impacts included (ecoinvent process)

recycled_materials_handling.database_allocation: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach adopted as default for secondary data and processes, conforming to EN 15804.

references: Australian Life Cycle Inventory Database Initiative Guidelines (2023)
British Standards Institution BS EN 15804:2012+A2:2019 and BS EN 16757:2017
Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water National Waste Report 2022
EPD International General Programme Instructions and PCR 2019:14 V1.3.4 (2024)
Man Yu et al., Procedia Engineering, Volume 180, 2017
